titles: A testimony to the truth of God, as held by the people, called, Quakers being a short vindication of them, from the abuses and misrepresentations often put upon them by envious apostates, and mercenary adversaries.
author: Penn, William, 1644-1718.
publisher: printed and sold by T. Sowle, in White-Hart-Court, in Gracious-Street,
notes: Reproduction of the original in the Friends House Library, London.
keywords: Society of Friends --  Doctrines --  Early works to 1800.
